item.description:
Note the unusual date.  David & June will be out of town on the normal first Saturday in December, so we're holding our Conversations meeting a week early on the weekend after Thanksgiving.

We'll watch and discuss three short videos on topics of interest to humanists:

  1. A debate sponsored by Intelligence Squared on whether the world would be better off without religion.  We'll take a look at the arguments by two speakers on each side of the proposition.
  2. "Thinking Our Way Out of Extinction," from a conference called the Nantucket Project.
  3. "Is Darwin the Father of Economics," a segment from the PBS News Hour.

Refreshments will be served.
item.how_to_find_us: We will probably be upstairs in the library, or in the social hall.
item.name: Conversations: Three short videos
